summary: An email from an NYPD detective forwarding arrest paperwork for Jeffrey Epstein, sent from a Xerox multifunction printer at a federal building in New York. The email contains an attachment of Epstein's arrest paperwork.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the arrest paperwork attached to the email.

events.title: Arrest paperwork scanned and sent
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's arrest paperwork was scanned and sent via email from a Xerox multifunction printer located at 290 Broadway.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 10, 2019, forwarding Jeffrey Epstein's arrest paperwork.
The arrest paperwork was scanned and sent on July 8, 2019, from a Xerox multifunction printer at 290 Broadway, 9th Floor, New York, NY.
The sender appears to be an NYPD detective from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating law enforcement involvement in the case.
